msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a Book of Hours for the Use of Paris, produced in the last quarter of the fifteenth century. It contains sixteen large miniatures marking the major divisions of the text, and seventeen seven-line miniatures illustrating the Gospel Lessons after John and the Suffrages. The calendar and the prayers from folios 146v-154r are in French.

msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Paris
Seven Requests to our Lord (in French)

supportDesc.extent: i+160+i; 164 x 107 mm bound to 176 x 125 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

p.catchwords: Faint catchwords visible at fols. 18v, 97v, 112v, and 120v

layoutDesc.layout: One column of eighteen lines; frame ruled in faint red ink; written area: 92 x 55 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Sixteen large miniatures with foliate borders (underdrawing for Tree of Jesse miniature visible on fol. 23r); seventeen small seven-line miniatures; illuminated initials and line-endings throughout; foliate panel borders on versos; miniatures (except for Tree of Jesse) surrounded by three- or four-sided panel borders; headings, golden letters and important feasts in calendar in raised gold
146vLarge miniature, Virgin and Child enthroned with two angels

binding.p: Twentieth-century brown calf with tooled panels; edges gilded

history.provenance: Sale by Sotheby's to Maggs (London, 6 May 1909, no. 24); Sessler (1911), sold to John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936
